subject: Re: Bangalore-3rd floor refurbishment - Design Discussion (Internal)
description:
+ Ishita Bhatia

Hi Sahil,
I have gone through the attached pdf shared by you, Pls see our inputs: 

Workstations
• Tabletops: I’ve suggested wooden-texture tabletops, similar to what WeWork uses. This can be ply or any higher quality alternative that comes at a better cost. I’ve already asked the admin team to arrange material samples.

• Partitions: The desk partitions will be mesh board style, with color options either: Yellow + Cyan Blue (like Skymark), or Deep Blue + Cyan Blue (Paytm’s brand tone). This will also help maintain visual energy and identity.

• Drawer Pedestal: Similar to Skymark – a two-tier drawer with a cushion seat on top to support impromptu seating and collaboration.

• Chairs: The current black mesh-back chairs used at Skymark are comfortable, so we can continue with the same.
However, I’ve asked the admin team to explore a few more color options, in case alternatives are available.

Pillars
Will be painted in Morning Glory, same as Skymark.

Ceiling & Ducting:
The ceiling and ducts will be grey, with red fire pipes visible, replicating the same industrial finish we have at Skymark.

Flooring:
New flooring options and carpet options to be explored, as the existing ones at Skymark have not aged well.

Breakout room on the floor:
To be designed exactly like Skymark, including tiles and layout.

Washrooms:
Admin is still working on layout and finishes; exploring better options here too.

Conference room naming & Design:
Room names will follow the Skymark pattern.

Next Steps:
Please arrange some samples (physical or images) for the table top and carpets whichever possible. Hope I have not missed anything here, let me know in case something else is required. 


Thanks,
Priya

On Fri, Jul 18, 2025 at 2:14 PM Sahil Goel <sahil.goel@paytm.com> wrote:
Hi Priya,

The height from finished floor level to bottom of the slab is  3.2 Mtr (10.5 Ft) at 3rd floor, Bangalore.

Regards,
Sahil Goel
+91-9468153210
Corporate Real Estate & Projects 




On Fri, Jul 18, 2025 at 1:04 PM Priya Saini <priya.saini@paytm.com> wrote:
Hi Sahil,
Could you please also help with the floor height. 

On Thu, Jul 17, 2025 at 11:47 AM Sahil Goel <sahil.goel@paytm.com> wrote:
Hi Priya,

Please find the attached list of finishes which was discussed earlier with Anand sir earlier in Jan 2025, for your reference.

Regards,
Sahil Goel
+91-9468153210
Corporate Real Estate & Projects 




On Wed, Jul 16, 2025 at 4:07 PM Priya Saini <priya.saini@paytm.com> wrote:
Hi Sahil,
As discussed, here is the excel link: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ts1LxNZiZ31Ws2T1DwqanWXmHWdxSi31wQrUBWaN7So/edit?gid=0#gid=0

On Mon, Jul 14, 2025 at 11:12 AM Anand Hirvey <anand.hirvey@paytm.com> wrote:
This requires a call. Priya and Hiren will take this up with me. 

--
Anand Hirvey
VP - Brand Identity & Communication
+91.9811216465 

This email, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient and may contain confidential information. If you are not the intended recipient, please immediately notify us by reply email or by telephone, delete this email and destroy any copies. Thank you.
On 14 Jul 2025 at 10:47 AM +0530, Sahil Goel <sahil.goel@paytm.com>, wrote:
Dear Anand sir and Priya,

As we are in the process of refurbishing the Paytm Bangalore office located at 3rd floor of the SJR the Hub. Request you to kindly review and share your inputs for the proposed 3-D design shared by the onboarded D&B vendor.
Proposed layout and the design deck attached with this mail for your review and inputs if any.

 Paytm - 3D Design PPT - 04.06.2025 (1).pdf

Regards,
Sahil Goel
+91-9468153210
Corporate Real Estate & Projects

+ Ishita Bhatia

Hi Sahil,
I have gone through the attached pdf shared by you, Pls see our inputs:

*Workstations*
* • Tabletops:* I’ve suggested wooden-texture tabletops, similar to what

* • Partitions: *The desk partitions will be mesh board style, with color

(Paytm’s brand tone). This will also help maintain visual energy and
identity.

* • Drawer Pedestal:* Similar to Skymark – a two-tier drawer with a cushion
seat on top to support impromptu seating and collaboration.

* • Chairs: *The current black mesh-back chairs used at Skymark are
comfortable, so we can continue with the same.
However, I’ve asked the admin team to explore a few more color options, in
case alternatives are available.

*Pillars*

*Ceiling & Ducting:*
The ceiling and ducts will be grey, with red fire pipes visible,
replicating the same industrial finish we have at Skymark.
